review: Had issues getting this to work initially on our home Wi-Fi network.  Even after speaking with a very helpful and knowledgeable representative from Google we still had to search newsgroups to see how others were troubleshooting networking problems.  Our problem was that the Chromecast device came up right away on our Wi-Fi net, I could see it and connect to it from any of several client devices (e.g., laptop or tablet), but it couldn't access the internet through our Wi-Fi router/firewall.  I finally stumbled across a solution, but I can't fully explain why my solution worked.  I tried assigning the device a static IP address from my Wi-Fi router setup menu and put it in a DMZ - giving it unfettered access to the internet through our firewall.  After doing that and rebooting, suddenly the Chromecast could see the internet and immediately "phoned home" to pull down a software update.  After it rebooted itself it began working flawlessly.  Not wanting to leave it exposed to the internet outside my firewall, I then changed the firewall settings to move the Chromecast back into the protected part of our home Wi-Fi network.  The Chromecast  continued to work fine, passing network traffic through our firewall without a problem.  Our internet service is through Time-Warner Cable, and we have a Motorola Router/Firewall/Wi-Fi device.  I'd give it a higher rating if not for the networking issues some folks seem to have when trying to first set up their device on their home Wi-Fi network.  I don't see how  you can beat it for the price.
